title: Netanyahu and an Israel Without Restraint
summary: With the assault on Gaza City, Israel’s prime minister has piled defiance on defiance, as any check from the Trump administration falls away.

title: Israel Pounds Gaza City as Fears Mount for Those Inside
summary: With hundreds of thousands of Palestinians still in the city, the Israeli military said it was opening another temporary evacuation route.

title: Israel’s Assault on Gaza City Stifles Hope of Diplomatic Resolution to War
summary: A negotiated settlement to end the fighting remains distant, in part because of the maximalist positions of Israel’s leader, Benjamin Netanyahu, and of Hamas.

title: Trump’s New Plan to Target Liberal Groups, and a Shouting Match in the Senate
summary: Plus, Robert Redford’s legacy.

title: Most U.K. Political Leaders Are Cautiously Welcoming Trump. Not This One.
summary: Ed Davey, of the Liberal Democrats, says that President Trump does not represent British values, and is boycotting a state dinner with the U.S. leader over Gaza.

title: Trump’s Second U.K. State Visit Draws Protests
summary: As President Trump arrived in Britain on Tuesday night, protesters unveiled visual stunts aimed at highlighting his ties to Jeffrey Epstein, while a march was planned for Wednesday.

title: Trump Invokes Kirk’s Killing in Seeking to Silence Opponents on Left
summary: In the wake of Charlie Kirk’s killing, President Trump and his allies have laid out a broad plan to target liberal groups, monitor speech, revoke visas and designate certain groups as domestic terrorists.

title: A Note, a Gun and a Mother’s Conscience Led to an Arrest in Kirk’s Killing
summary: The man accused of shooting Charlie Kirk left a trail of evidence and had no way to outrun his parents’ recognition, court documents showed.

title: After Kirk’s Killing, Obama Says the Nation Is in a ‘Political Crisis’
summary: Speaking at an educational summit, former President Barack Obama criticized his successor’s attacks on his political rivals in the wake of Charlie Kirk’s assassination.

title: As Trump Arrives, Europe’s Right Claims Charlie Kirk as One of Their Own
summary: After decades of claiming persecution, once marginalized parties latch on to the American activist’s assassination as proof of their victimization.

title: Investors Are Bullish as a Pivotal Fed Decision Looms
summary: The S&P 500 is in record territory, and investors are pricing in a quarter-point cut to interest rates on Wednesday.

title: What to Watch at the Federal Reserve’s September Meeting
summary: The U.S. central bank is widely expected to cut interest rates for the first time this year, despite the economy sending mixed signals.

title: Is the Economy as Healthy as Trump Claims?
summary: As the Fed meets, we examine the nation’s economic health.

title: It Isn’t Just the U.S. The Whole World Has Soured on Climate Politics.
summary: How do we think about the climate future, now that the era marked by the Paris Agreement has so utterly disappeared?

title: Climate Change’s Toll in Europe This Summer: Thousands of Extra Deaths
summary: Three times as many people in cities and towns died from severe heat as would have done in a world without human-caused warming, scientists said.

title: Jerry of Ben & Jerry’s Resigns, Saying Company Has Been ‘Silenced’
summary: Jerry Greenfield said that the ice cream company, known for its activism, had been muzzled by Unilever, its parent company.

title: How Nepal’s Government Went Up in Smoke
summary: Arson attacks during protests in Nepal destroyed buildings, court files and even records of international agreements and state investments.

title: Robert Redford: A Classic American Ideal Who Escaped the Mold
summary: Though he got his start under the old studio system, he remained a natural in the New Hollywood and beyond.

title: Robert Redford’s Many Types of Heroes
summary: The Outlaw, the Romantic, the Survivor: From the Sundance Kid to his final role, he showed different ways to be a hero onscreen.

title: The ‘Most Colorful Home in Queens’ Has a Dark Secret
summary: Inside the real estate scam that tore through a tight-knit immigrant community in New York.

title: A Stone-Skimming Contest in Scotland Is Infiltrated by Cheaters
summary: “I did see some stones that looked a little too perfect,” said the winner of the Stone Skimming World Championships. The offending contestants were disqualified.

title: What Democrats Can Learn From Charlie Kirk
summary: He built one of the most effective youth mobilization machines in recent memory.

title: Tina Brown: When Trump Visits King Charles III
summary: He may be the last man standing who can exude global gravitas in the dumpster fire of our digitally dominated world.

title: Jimmy Fallon Teases Trump’s U.K. Trip
summary: The “Tonight Show” host said the royal couple are the president’s “second-favorite king and queen, next to Burger and Dairy.”

title: Driver Crashes Car Into F.B.I. Field Office Gate in Pittsburgh
summary: A driver rammed into the entrance of the compound and fled on foot in what officials believed to be a targeted act. Officials named a suspect.

title: Has Britain Gone Too Far With Its Digital Controls?
summary: British authorities have ramped up the use of facial recognition, artificial intelligence and internet regulation to address crime and other issues, stoking concerns of surveillance overreach.

title: German Man Suspected in Madeleine McCann Disappearance Is Released From Prison
summary: Eighteen years after Madeleine McCann, a 3-year-old British girl, disappeared in Portugal, the man considered a suspect by Britain and Germany was released after serving a sentence in a separate case.

title: Tossup Race for NJ Governor Draws Big Money and a Bright Spotlight
summary: National party leaders have taken a keen interest in the race for governor of New Jersey, where Jack Ciattarelli, a Republican, is competing against Representative Mikie Sherrill, a Democrat.
